Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Public Safety

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD and DOE to conduct an annual review and assessment of the need for school safety agents at each school operated by the DOE.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 226-A, in relation to requiring the police department and the department of education to provide the public with information regarding school violence.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int 226-A, Provide the public with information regarding school violence.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 322-A, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.

Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. 322-A, Requiring the NYPD and DOE to conduct an annual review and assessment of the need for school safety agents at each school operated by the DOE.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Public Safety
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the police department and the department of education to provide the public with information regarding school violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the police department and the department of education to provide the public with information regarding school violence.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
